review_title: Incredible hospice and neurological care shame about the toxic central fundraising office environment
pros: Fantastic cause and the care in the hospices, neurological centres and community is incredible.
cons:
The London central fundraising office is a toxic environment to work in where there is a culture of bullying and intimidation within central fundraising. The charity had been suffering  from a somewhat confused public perception in being known for their shops more than their care. Although a national corporate partnership is helping to address this, The charity spends just over £5 million a year to raise just over £13 million a year from fundraising according to annual accounts 13/14. A very poor return on investment.
Sue Ryder spends less than half of its expenditure  on  charitable activities. SMT salaries are over inflated and despite a charity of this size needing to attract staff of the highest calibre they have sadly become even more of a corporate style charity.

No praise or encouragement but constant criticism and definitely no recognition for the wonderful job the nursing staff do. Poor  bank holiday pay. They chose to use the NHS as a bench mark for terms and conditions when it suits,  yet Uk Christmas banks holidays are not bank holidays in Sue Ryder land.  Total lack of understanding that it's the goodwill and high standards of nurses that keep the donations flooding in and that without this the organisation would suffer greatly.  Constant turnover of staff. Moral is rock bottom
